website_summaries.verdict: An affordable drywall lift with many of the same features as other brands, but quality varies.
pros: Lifts panels up to 11 feet high for flat ceilings and 13 feet for walls
Easy to assemble with a weight limit of 150 pounds
cons: Welding on the metal parts can be sloppy and it’s not as durable as other brands

customer_reviews.title: Awesome piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. I was given an estimate by a local contractor to drywall my room addition. I did a cost comparison and I could buy this machine and all material for less than half of his estimate. So I did and let me tell you. I was able to drywall my ceiling and walls with 1/2"x4'x8' and 1/2"x4'x12' drywall by myself and it looks great. This machine is well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: GREAT LITTLE DRYWALL LIFT
customer_reviews.text: I LIKE THIS LIFT. WORKS GREAT, BUT I WOULDNT NOT RECOMEND IT FOR USE COMMERCIALLY, THIS UNIT IS NOT DESIGNED FOR HEAVY DUTY USE, ALL I KNOW IT PAYED FOR ITS SELF IF I HAD TO RENT ONE, 3 DAYS OF HANGING DRYWALL PAYED FOR THIS UNIT THEY WANTED 60.00 A DAY TO RENT ONE. VERY TO PUT TOGETHER I DIDNT EVEN NEED DIRECTIONS, ALL SELF EXPLANITORY. TOO BAD ITS MADE IN CHINA, ITS A GOOD DESIGN. PROBABLY COPPIED ONE MADE IN AMERICA.
customer_reviews.author: PINEAPPLE AMERICA

customer_reviews.title: GARBAGE
customer_reviews.text: The arm locking mechanism is a bad design and does not lock in. Pins on both arms broke within 10 sheets of drywall. Wheels lost bearing right away. The lifting crank bent into the cable and stops at 7 feet for height. This is the worse lift ever made. I bought a different one from a different supplier on AMAZON the next day because I needed on asap. It was the same garbage as this one. Found one at menards store and it work great. 29 years of drywalling and this is the biggest piece of garbage I have ever seen. Cost me a day of hanging.
customer_reviews.author: the truth

customer_reviews.title: Ease of lifting the plywood with the turn of a wheel
customer_reviews.text: This Jack allowed my 70 year old husband and I the ability to a plywood ceiling up in our 30x48 garage/Shop by ourselves. It works very easy. It rolls easy and has good brakes so it doesn't move after we positioned the 4'x8' plywood panels in place. The price and fast delivery was great. I would recommend this to anyone putting up ceilings! Thank you! Norma in Iowa
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... struts on the wheel base broke because of a poor weld. I contacted the company who then asked ...
customer_reviews.text: One of the struts on the wheel base broke because of a poor weld. I contacted the company who then asked me to send pictures of the broken weld (see attached). I followed up with the company several times but never heard back from them. Eventually I took the lift to a welder and had them repair it. It more or less did it's job then.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew E. Cox

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous product! So worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome product! Can't beat it's usefulness for the cost. I removed 10 8' fluorescent fixtures, hung the entire 24x24 ceiling and reinstalled by myself with zero difficulty This purchase was split by my brother and I. I hung my garage and will be doing a section of basement ceiling. It is assembled and broken down with no tolls required. Simple. Stores in a 3 piece very small space He will be doing his exterior porch ceiling and basement. When we are both done, he will put it up on e-bay/craigs list and we will split the proceeds. Could not be more worth it!!!
customer_reviews.author: W. Linnert

customer_reviews.title: Great value, moderate quality
customer_reviews.text: I am satisfied. A higher quality unit would have been preferable, but for the price I feel like it was better than I could have reasonably expected. Don't let the 5 star rating fool you. This is not the ideal tool. It can be a bit finiky and it isn't the smoothest operating lift on the market. It is however serviceable and a great value. If your gonna use a lift every day, buy a better one. If you need something that will get you through the occasional project, I think this will suffice.
customer_reviews.author: Don Juan Dubbl

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny!
customer_reviews.text: If you are hanging sheetrock on the ceiling...getting rid of that textured ceiling...this makes it easy to do. We used up to 12 foot sheets on our ceiling and this made it a breeze...Probably need an extra hand getting the sheetrock in the hoist unless you are a brawny man but after loading it is a breeze to lift and place. The four point base makes this very stable and the two wood "shelves" make standing to screw in the sheetrock very easy. This is a must have to save your back and shoulders or for individual hanging.
customer_reviews.author: Debra RN

customer_reviews.title: do it by yourself
customer_reviews.text: Allows me to work on ceilings by myself, making this tool rather invaluable. Tired of depending on others to help with the job?? Invest in this.. Only problem I had with it is the apparatus feels a bit shaky, if there was a better way to secure the pieces after connected it might be a little more sturdy, but honestly for the price its perfect and gets the job done
customer_reviews.author: Jamie P.

customer_reviews.title: A huge help
customer_reviews.text: The only issue we had was putting it together. After that it was a huge help. Our previous lift was so old. This was a very nice upgrade. We 15’ at the peak for our ceilings so we pushed it to its max and then had to lift the rest of the way but everywhere else it was so helpful. The tilt really helped on the vaulted ceilings. I didn’t have any issues with the stability of it. We used 12’ sheets of drywall with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wilhelm

customer_reviews.title: Did what it was supposed to do . Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to lift 3 sheets of 14 ft drywall. I know it states 8 ft max. But I figured what the hell. It worked fine. Once the drywall was centered it lifted it up fairly easily. I have no idea how anyone even with help and using all their tricks could do without one of these. I bought it vs rental because I have 5 rooms to do this summer, and when done I could still sell it for a few bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Saved my back!!
customer_reviews.text: I think as other have stated, this may not hold up for a construction site and daily use, but for a homeowner redoing a kitchen ceiling it was worth every penny. I am not sure how I would have done it otherwise. This was easy to use and held the drywall in place right where I wanted it.
customer_reviews.author: hmarie2

customer_reviews.title: Good solution!
customer_reviews.text: My roof and ceiling was destroyed in Hurricane Michael at Panama City. Catch 22, we are not covered. I am 70 years old now and have my limits. No way I can hold up a sheet of sheet rock and secure it to a ceiling. This was just the product I needed!
customer_reviews.author: kent dubose

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is crap. Never worked. I contacted the company they asked for pics. The pictures aren't good enough because they don't show that the pieces are defective. Basically I have a hunk of junk that cost me 130.00 and the company won't do anything. Very upsetting.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, not the best quality
customer_reviews.text: Works great Decent quality. I don't regret buying, but if I were looking for a great quality tool I was going to use on many jobs I would spend the money and get a heavy duty hoist instead of this one. Does just fine for small jobs though.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Necessary Tool for DIY large project
customer_reviews.text: Not only did the lift save my back, I was able to have this large item prime delivered faster than I could find one locally. I was dreading what I assume would be a nuisance of an assembly, especially for such a good price. However, the enitre lift can be assembled in less than 3 minutes. Not sure how some of the features would hold up to a professional use, however when I asked a neighbor who is a professional if he had one, he just laughed at me and said they just lift them. Worked perfect for a DIY guy. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Different Locking system
customer_reviews.text: Locking mechanism is in the form of a brake. It can give way if bumped or not tight and drywall will come crashing down.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: But if you are not a professional drywall installer this item is excellent..
customer_reviews.text: Item as described... only difference between this product and the $1200.00 professional versions is that this is not as heavy duty. But if you are not a professional drywall installer this item is excellent... my reason for purchase is that I needed a lift for and extended period of time and did not want to pay for multiple weeks of rental. This item cost less than one weeks rental from Home Depot. So its a win win for me.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: great lift
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and works very well. Installed 60 sheets of 4 x 8 OSB to upper walls and ceiling of new garage. No problems with this lift at all and it cost less than renting a lifter from local rental company for one week.Paint is very good on this unit and rolls easily across concrete floor.
customer_reviews.author: RAGU

customer_reviews.title: Crappy Drywall lift, want my money back Asap
customer_reviews.text: No likes about this product, I basically paid and waited for a totally broken product to be delivered. The lift won't lift drywall to the full height advertised, false advertisement! You product doesn't perform according to your specs. This defective product cost me a $5000 job! Your quality control agent should be fired, or you all should be ashamed of sending hard working Americans poor quality products, for their hard earned American dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Tyrone

customer_reviews.title: Good  budget drywall lift
customer_reviews.text: This drywall lift was easy to use for both 8' ceilings and for upper horizontal sheets on the wall. I was able to hang drywall by myself using this lift.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Buy this if you are doing a sheetrock ceiling alone.
customer_reviews.text: Best money I ever spent on a piece of specialty equipment. It took me about 20 minutes to assemble, starting with opening the instruction booklet. Thoughtfully designed, well constructed, easy to use. Also easy to knock down for storage. Much better quality that the price might lead one to expect. Easily worth twice the price for the quality, ease of use, and, most important, the enhanced safety it brings to doing a sheetrock ceiling by yourself.
customer_reviews.author: John L

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome machine, nice and strong, easy to set up. I liked it so much I bought another. The assistance it provides is invaluable in many types of jobs, not just drywall.
customer_reviews.author: Dad of 8

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lift to complete my basement drywall. If I still had the box I would have sent it back. It comes apart easily during use, It leans back too far so your drywall slides. The inside cable was twisted and had to be fixed. The tilt does go to 90 degrees so you cannot use it on walls. Poor product design and hard to use makes this lift useless.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas N.

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.text: The product is a little more expensive than some of the other ones but you get what you pay for and it’s not nearly as expensive as the professional models that start at $800. It allows easy one man use doing tall ceilings. Upper walls are a little more difficult because the sheet of drywall is at an angle and you have to lean it in so it really needs two people for handling it well. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Brian from Placerville

customer_reviews.title: Its like fishing in a barrell
customer_reviews.text: Tall friends would be better.. this thing is lonely .. but can handle a 8 foot short of 5/8 all day and night
customer_reviews.author: Anthony C.

customer_reviews.title: Well designed for easy assembly and use.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and take apart. Just snaps together. Makes it easy to move in a regular car and move to different floors. Light but strong and steady.
customer_reviews.author: Leo P.

customer_reviews.title: Make life easier
customer_reviews.text: This purchase was extremely helpful in doing rehab in an apartment building that requires intensive drywalling installation. Makes life so much easier, and makes the process quicker. Only complaint is that it’s slightly cumbersome to move.
customer_reviews.author: Melibee

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the $$
customer_reviews.text: Never had used a drywall jack so I'm not sure what they are supposed to do. This one doesn't press again the ceiling level...one side is about an inch lower, and the drywall isn't held to where it doesn't pivot when it's raised to working height. That has been a minor irritation. Other than that it's tons better than the home-crafted T-bar setup I have used in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Hubbard

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: purchased a couple of years ago for a project and just used it. very pleased. worked well and i sheet rocked the ceilings in an entire house alone.
customer_reviews.author: Michaela C. Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: It is great! We are doing my whole ceiling in my living room and a bunch of other rooms. It is going to save me tons of money renting one was the same cost
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product, does what it says to the letter. Easy to assemble and operate.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this to help him hang metal on the ceiling of his shop. It works great. He wouldn’t be able to do it without it.
customer_reviews.author: Christa Dailey

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken and parts installed backwards. Want me to pay return shipping...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with a wheel completely token off. The weld (if it could be called that) was just snapped. Return was accepted... But requires all original packaging. And they want me to pay return shipping... On a 117 lbs gross weight package. Well, you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dependable piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: It was relatively simple to put together. I went to youtube to find a video on putting it together which helped alot. I am going to use it to put up a ceiling that had a lot of water damage. I would recommend it. It breaks down easy too.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: But it you will love it.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome....I have rented some in the past that were just not has well built as this one. I'm sure there might be better ones out there but for the cost of this one it is an awesome deal. I love it and I think any professional would say the same thing. Very nice quality.
customer_reviews.author: Stan Baker

customer_reviews.title: Money maker
customer_reviews.text: Truly a handyman Baker and he used to install sheetrock used it three times during my purchase. Big Money
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: OK for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I hung 16, 4x8’s. It did the job. I wouldn’t want to do 4x12’s, it’s just not stable enough. Unfortunately one of the casters bent and the balls came out, so I swapped out all three for better quality ones. The legs are sloppy and the locking pin mechanism is an awful design. For the price, I think it’s OK all things considered.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: Worked better than expected . 16 foot sheets on ceilings no problem
customer_reviews.author: DANIEL PARNELL

customer_reviews.title: this thing works like a champ
customer_reviews.text: For hanging ceiling drywall 4 x 8 sheets by yourself, A MUST HAVE! I usually hand drywall by myself and doing ceilings is tough. Well, this thing works like a champ!
customer_reviews.author: Tania Baaske

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for
customer_reviews.text: I used it for installing a interior metal roof in my car trailer. Worked great for that
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: Junk the wheel that you use to left drywall bends 2-3” and binds against arm of lift making it very difficult to lift drywall. The brake release goes past the stopping point and you have to use a rubber mallet or hammer to hit it back to release.
customer_reviews.author: daniel jemmott

customer_reviews.title: WORTH it
customer_reviews.text: Used for finishing our basement. Was less than a rental. Easy to take apart and store.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 2 and Special Ed Teacher

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't recommend for anything over 9 ft without some modification.
customer_reviews.text: Does the job, but the lift post is poorly secured to the base. Would not be safe at 15' or even 11' without some modification to the post to base connection.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: My shoulders are both in bad shape and this hoist works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I use it to get big heavy boxes out of a loft. My shoulders are both in bad shape and this hoist works perfectly. It was very easy to assemble and it breaks down into smaller pieces that are smaller, lighter and easy to store. I am very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Does what it’s supposed to. One of the plastic clips broke but it’s still functional
customer_reviews.author: HiThere

customer_reviews.title: A little confusing to set up at first, but once You studie the parts, it all makes sense.
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is... it's a good investment. It's easy to handle, and very reliable, compared to the relative who never showed up to help.
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Great DIY tool for a small job. I used it to hang maybe 10 8 foot sheet of dry wall. It lasted till the last sheet before the wheel assembly bent. I could still use it but it was a pain in the ass.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: No regrets
customer_reviews.text: Actually better quality than I expected. Works really well and its easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: jose

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the $ there are better lifts for the same money
customer_reviews.text: Stop mechanism is not long enough and doesn’t touch the floor to stop lift from rolling.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good lift, had to modify it because inside track was bent
customer_reviews.text: The lift works now after about 90 minutes working on the bent metal that didn't allow it to extend and retract.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Schaefer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble this machine worked perfectly made my job sooo easy. Extremely happy with purchase highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: David Green

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous and poorly made.
customer_reviews.text: One of the most dangerous pieces of equipment I have used. The extending arm brake will not support it's own weight and will crash down on you as soon as you let go of the wheel. It is poorly constructed and not worth the time.
customer_reviews.author: luca Cicilese

customer_reviews.title: Worked for the job, However not as durable as ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked for the job, However not as durable as the ones you rent at Home Depot, The pulley kept turning sideways and the cable will get snagged, Overall big lifesaver when hanging rock on the ceiling
customer_reviews.author: Richard Salmonsen

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: satisfied and priced right. got a lot done with it.
customer_reviews.author: younghui han

customer_reviews.title: Assembles and operates very easily
customer_reviews.text: Used it for hanging Sheetrock on my ceiling which is 2/12 pitch and 15’high at center. Worked well. Very heavy duty compared to the other cheaper models.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Sorensen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I've been hanging drywall on side projects for 15 years and this is the first time that I haven't had to get a bunch of guys when I hung the ceiling. That alone made it worth every penny. It arrived in two days and has worked for Perfectly on this new addition I've been putting on my parents house. It has a few features I didn't even realize it had like the ability to accommodate vaulted ceiling. I highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: It did the job really well but the wheel is ...
customer_reviews.text: It did the job really well but the wheel is a bit crooked and it seems eventually it will fail
customer_reviews.author: joe snake salazar

customer_reviews.title: A Back saver!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Rented one a few years ago, but restoring an older home with many ceilings and walls, so was a perfect time to buy
customer_reviews.author: Allan Smith

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It’s at a very nice lift it works very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Owen Molina

customer_reviews.title: Well built. Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend this to anyone who has a fair amount of drywall to hang. It really works well.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Towne

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my job
customer_reviews.text: Only thing I can’t figure out is how to keep the pin locked to keep the legs spread. Other than that it is worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than renting a dry wall jack or having a contractor come in to do the work.
customer_reviews.text: Much easier to do ceiling drywall. Not the easiest to move alone when loaded. Seems pretty wobbly and can make small adjustments hard.
customer_reviews.author: NAME_NOT_NO

customer_reviews.title: Great lift at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Great price for a great product, allowed me to completely drywall a small addition by myself.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff B

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fairly shaky, but gets the job done. Cable has stuff stuck in the winding. Crank does not align well.
customer_reviews.author: Falcon Song

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: You made my job easier and less back ache. I love it. Albert Mendoza
customer_reviews.author: Albert Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Used heavily, no problems with it yet. Not even scratches. A good buy.
customer_reviews.author: w. tyler sall

customer_reviews.title: Worked as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Worked as advertised did my garage ceiling all by myself
customer_reviews.author: james richard presley

customer_reviews.title: Caster issues.
customer_reviews.text: The lift worked great at first. Then one of the wheels started loosing its bearings. Had to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: JSlippey

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: Works great and cost the same as renting one for the week
customer_reviews.author: rick

customer_reviews.title: home improvement back saver
customer_reviews.text: Lift works great and as intended. simple set up and a real back saver.
customer_reviews.author: Mark M.

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: My husband got this in the other day the whole metal was bent and he couldn’t even put it together.
customer_reviews.author: Laura roberts

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: The bottom base does not stay standing up and doesn't support the top. Never even been used once. It's made so cheap. Very unhappy
customer_reviews.author: Micheal Henry

customer_reviews.title: Worked good.. Got it when I needed it and ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked good.. Got it when I needed it and it was okay, the arm bent and needed to be reinforced but after I did that it went easy..
customer_reviews.author: Linda McFarland

customer_reviews.title: Back saver
customer_reviews.text: Great time save makes hanging 4. X 12 x 5/8 drywall with two men easy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Lift
customer_reviews.text: Works great for the price. Used to finish basement. Best investment of the whole job. Could have improved stability however.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Item!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, I was able to install ceilings all by myself!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: DURABLE
customer_reviews.text: Its durable, almost a must have if working alone. Havent had any problems with it yet
customer_reviews.author: Bordncaney

customer_reviews.title: this makes lifting sheetrock a lot easier and faster. ...
customer_reviews.text: this makes lifting sheetrock a lot easier and faster. the cable makes some noise, but has not been a problem
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together and easy to use. Saves us so much time!
customer_reviews.author: Jeanna Brower

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy and sturdy. Very useful and does exactly what is required.
customer_reviews.author: James MacCune

customer_reviews.title: I am very satisfied with this lift
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied with this lift. It is solidly built, sturdier than I anticipated and easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product, operated perfectly and saved a lot of strenuous lifting.
customer_reviews.author: Rex Tate

customer_reviews.title: Heavy gauge steel drywall lift - Flawless transaction
customer_reviews.text: Flawless transaction. Seller shipped my order immediately. Excellent packaging with absolutely no damage. Very happy with this drywall lift. Very heavy duty. Should easily last me a lifetime. Exceeds all claims made by seller. Works as well or better than lifts I've used over the past 35 years, most costing triple what this one cost. The welds and black paint job are very well done, and I love the oversize sturdy casters. They roll over practically every surface with ease. Will do business with this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.text: This piece of equipment turned me into a drywall professional, great purchase now I can quit nagging my friends to come over and help me.
customer_reviews.author: kyle linscott

customer_reviews.title: Other than that it worked fine.
customer_reviews.text: It work ok. Bolt on crank should be bigger or hardened.when using 12 foot 5/8 the bolt bent. Other than that it worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Todd N.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Very good tool. Nice and heavy but rolled around perfectly. I used it to finish my basement. I was able to take my time hanging drywall over renting a lift. It saved me a bundle of money. The instructions are a little vague but it goes together pretty easily. Only criticism is that you don't need to crank it tight to the ceiling - if you do there's a thin piece of metal holding the hand crank that will start to bend. Just crank it up snug and it's fine. Don't expect a commercial tool that you can use everyday - but if you have a few projects to complete it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Silver11

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Performance was perfect. Worth the money. Way better than the cheaper ones.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: not disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I thought at this price I would be getting something of poorish quality. But, its a fine machine packed well, it assembled easily and so far its been working great. I've been using it for 12 foot sheets of 5/8 firestop. In the past I've rented these and this one is no different from the rentals. Its nicely finished and the folding design it pretty clever. I've only used it on 8 foot ceilings I don't know how it would do on 11 foot lifts but I am guessing pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: thomas

customer_reviews.title: Right on time!
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift,and he loved it,and i loved that it save me money and was delivered on time for the special occasion!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good lift.  Instructions need improvement.
customer_reviews.text: The lift worked very well. I was removing a skylight and needed a way to lower the large sheets of glass and raise a piece of plywood. The lift easily cleared the one story roof. My only complaint would be that the instructions were not the best. They needed an illustration of how the handle on the crank wheel installs, and there is a nice numbered diagram of parts, but no numbered list to go with it. Minor inconveniences for a good piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: rlrhodes

customer_reviews.title: A good buy for the money...
customer_reviews.text: The wheel that the spool is connected to was wielded on a bit crooked. Not enough to impede the operation, but it does look poor. That said, I ordered from OneBigOutlet (based in CA) on a Thursday and received the following Thursday in MN. It was well packed and no damage during shipping. Pretty easy to put together and works well. It is as good as a rental unit. I've been using it to put 5/8" drywall on a 10' ceiling by myself. If I had a need for a tool like this to make a living I'd probably look for something of higher quality, but it's just fine for my current needs and didn't break the bank.
customer_reviews.author: Brad_MN

customer_reviews.title: The metal clip that holds the wheel out bent before ...

product_meta.title: ARKSEN Drywall Panel Lift Dry Wall Panel Hoist Adjustable Lockable Lifter Ceiling Max 11 FT w/Caster Wheels, Yellow
product_meta.description:
Drywall sheets can weigh up to 150 lbs. making installation a two man (or even three man) job. With a Arksen drywall lift, you can install full sheets of drywall in a fraction of the time and you can do it with no help.

Feature:
Contractor Grade - Crafted from extra-duty, all-welded steel, this drywall lift can hoist panels up to 4’ x 8’ in size, with a maximum load of 150 pounds, and is designed to last a lifetime
Sturdy - A 5’ wide tripod base is supported by anti-slip, non-marring casters that won't damage floors; a 3" triangular frame (in 4' sections) features oversized lock nuts and clevis pins at critical pivot-points, and the base includes a flip-down backstop to secure the lift's position for mounting
Eliminate Risk- Eliminate risk of injury due to the heavy lifting, Prevent strain and injury by letting the lift do all the hard work
Large Cradle - Extends to 10' in width, has rubber caps on 3-position auto-locking outriggers to protect your material, and also features panel support hooks; it retracts to just 36" from the floor when tilted for easy loading
Lifting Winch - Simple-to-operate, single-stage winch (18" wheel, 4" handle) with an extra-strong, braided-steel lifting cable; it includes a brake and a capped handle to protects hands
Easy to Use - Quick, tool-free setup and disassemble for storage

Specifications:
Color: Yellow
Max reach for horizontal ceilings: 11-feet
Max single sheet capacity: up to 4 X 8-feet
Max load rating: 150-lbs
Casters Size: 5"-inch
Horizontal ceilings max reach: 11ft, angled ceiling Up to 15ft
Assembly Require: Yes
Max Reach for walls: 15-feet; (11-foot maximum lift and half the length of drywall)

Package Include:
Drywall Panel Lift
Manual
feature_bullets: Contractor Grade - Crafted from extra-duty, all-welded steel, this drywall lift can hoist panels up to 4’ x 16’ in size, with a maximum load of 150 pounds, and is designed to last a lifetime

Large Cradle - Extends to 10' in width, has rubber caps on 3-position auto-locking outriggers to protect your material, and also features panel support hooks; it retracts to just 36" from the floor when tilted for easy loading
Lifting Winch - Simple-to-operate, single-stage winch (18" wheel, 4" handle) with an extra-strong, braided-steel lifting cable; it includes a brake and a capped handle to protects hands

Versatile - Features a 11’ reach for flat ceilings and over 13' reach on walls/angled ceilings; the cradle rotates 360°, tilts 65° forward/backward and 10° side-to-side for use on both flat and sloped ceilings
Easy to Use - Quick, tool-free setup and disassembly for storage
